laŭda Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: benedíxit fíliîs tuîs in te. ^ Because he hath strengthened the bolts of thy gates, he hath blessed thy children within thee.

1 ^ Laŭda, Jerúsalim, Dòminum~: 3 ^ Qŭi pósuit fines tuos pacem, et ádipe frumènti sátiat te. ^ Who hath placed peace in thy borders, and filleth thee with the fat of corn.

laŭda Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: velóciter currit sermo ejus. ^ Who sendeth forth his speech to the earth~
nèbulam sicut cìnerem spargit. ^ Who giveth snow like wool~
¿~ante fáciem frígoris ejus qŭìs sustinébit~? ^ He sendeth his crystal like morsels~
who shall stand before the face of his cold~?

1 ^ Laŭda, Jerúsalim, Dòminum~: 7 ^ Emìttet vèrbum suum, et liqŭefáciet ea~
laŭda Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: flabit spíritus ejus, et fluent aqŭaĕ. ^ He shall send out his word, and shall melt them~
his wind shall blow, and the waters shall run.

laŭda Deum tuum, Sion. ^ Praise the Lor: justìtias et judìcia sua Israhéli. ^ Who declareth his word to Jacob~
his justices and his judgments to Israel.

1 ^ Laŭda, Jerúsalim, Dòminum~: 9 ^ Non fecit táliter òmni natióni, et judìcia sua non manifestávit eîs. ^ He hath not done in like manner to every nation, and his judgments he hath not made manifest to them.
